intro: Diplospora negrosensis, commonly known as the Negros spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has simple, alternate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
